net.proteusframework.core.locale

Class JDBCLocaleSource

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.core.locale.JDBCLocaleSource
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    LocaleSource

    public class JDBCLocaleSource
extends java.lang.Object
implements LocaleSource
    Implementation of LocaleSource that stores localized information in a database via JDBC. This implementation does not cache LocalizedObjects. For performance reasons, an appropriate implementation of LocaleContext should be chosen or a wrapper implementation of LocaleSource that addresses the need for caching if it exists.

    NOTE:
    The JDBCLocaleSource class offers a couple "unique" features. This implementation is not guaranteed to generate keys correctly if more than one instance of JDBCLocaleSource is modifying data at the same time (for the same data source and table). Also, this implementation stores all data in the same database table. As a result, the static i18n key is stored in the same table even though it is not always used. This is to ensure that the static key is unique. Both of these features help provide support for additional databases. If these features do not meet your needs, you will need to use an alternate implementation of LocaleSource and register it with LocaleContext.setLocaleSource(LocaleSource).

    Author:
    Russ Tennant (russ@proteus.co)

      • invalidate

        public void invalidate(LocalizedObject lo,
                       java.util.Locale locale)
        Description copied from interface: LocaleSource
        Invalidate cache for a LocalizedObject modification if this locale source supports caching. Also invalidates the parent LocaleSource (if one exists). All cached instances for the key and same language (regardless of country and variant) should be invalidated as well since a fallback mechanism may provide the text for a locale other than the one specified.
        Specified by:
        invalidate in interface LocaleSource
        Parameters:
        lo - The LocalizedObject to invalidate.
        locale - the Locale identifying the object to invalidate in the cache. May be null to indicate that all localizations for a given key should be localized.

        Specified by:
        remove in interface LocaleSource
        Parameters:

        locale - the locale. Optional. If null, the all localizations are removed.
        Throws:

                              throws LocaleSourceException
        Description copied from interface: LocaleSource
        Resolve a key. This will populate the database identifier into the key as well as the symbolic name. The keys are guaranteed to be equals, but may not be the same (identity).
        Specified by:
        resolveKey in interface LocaleSource
        Parameters:
        key - the key. May be null.
        Returns:
        the resolved key or null if there is no localization for the specified key.
        Throws:
        LocaleSourceException - if an error occurs accessing the LocaleSource.

      • resolveKeys

        public java.util.List<LocalizedObjectKey> resolveKeys(java.util.Collection<LocalizedObjectKey> keys)
                                               throws LocaleSourceException
        Description copied from interface: LocaleSource
        Resolve several keys. This will populate the database identifier into the key as well as the symbolic name. The keys are guaranteed to be equal, but may not be the same (identity). Any keys that are not resolvable will be added to the result unmodified.
        Specified by:
        resolveKeys in interface LocaleSource
        Parameters:
        keys - the keys.
        Returns:
        the resolved keys.
        Throws:
        LocaleSourceException - if an error occurs accessing the LocaleSource.

      • retrieve

        public <L extends LocalizedObject> java.util.List<L> retrieve(java.util.Collection<LocalizedObjectKey> keys,
                                                              java.util.Locale locale,
                                                              @Nullable java.lang.Class<L> typeHint,
                                                              boolean fallBack)
                                                       throws LocaleSourceException
        Description copied from interface: LocaleSource
        Retrieve the LocalizedObjects for the specified keys and locale. Implementations can optionally return another object if the localized object cannot be found for a specific locale. If the key is not found, then the implementation must throw an exception. If the key is static, then the real key must be stored with the symbolic name. This is the same as calling LocaleSource.resolveKey(LocalizedObjectKey). LocalizedObjects stored with a symbolic name should always return the symbolic name. The key specified must always be equal to the key returned with the LocalizedObject although they may not necessarily be the same key (identity).
        Specified by:
        retrieve in interface LocaleSource
        Type Parameters:
        L - the localized object parameter type.
        Parameters:
        keys - the keys.
        locale - the locale.
        typeHint - the type that is expected to be returned. Optional, may be null.
        fallBack - flag that indicates whether the returned localized objects may be retrieved by falling back to less specific locales. If the flag is false, then it is possible that not all the localized objects will be returned.
        Returns:
        the LocalizedObjects.
        Throws:
        LocaleSourceException - if an error occurs accessing the LocaleSource or the LocalizedObject cannot be found or generated for the specified key and locale.

      • retrieve

        public <L extends LocalizedObject> L retrieve(LocalizedObjectKey key,
                                              java.util.Locale locale,
                                              java.lang.Class<L> typeHint,
                                              boolean fallback)
                                       throws LocaleSourceException
        Description copied from interface: LocaleSource
        Retrieve the LocalizedObject for the specified key and locale. Implementations can optionally return another object if the localized object cannot be found for a specific locale. If the key is not found, then the implementation must throw an exception. If the key is static, then the real key must be stored with the symbolic name. This is the same as calling LocaleSource.resolveKey(LocalizedObjectKey). LocalizedObjects stored with a symbolic name should always return the symbolic name. The key specified must always be equal to the key returned with the LocalizedObject although they may not necessarily be the same key (identity).
        Specified by:
        retrieve in interface LocaleSource
        Type Parameters:
        L - the localized object parameter type.
        Parameters:
        key - the key.
        locale - the locale.
        typeHint - the type that is expected to be returned. Optional, may be null.
        fallback - flag that indicates whether the returned object may be retrieved by falling back to less specific locales If the flag is false, then the object must be an exact match for the specified locale.
        Returns:
        the LocalizedObject. Never null.
        Throws:
        LocaleSourceException - if an error occurs accessing the LocaleSource or the LocalizedObject cannot be found or generated for the specified key and locale.

                                           java.util.Locale locale)
                                    throws LocaleSourceException
        Description copied from interface: LocaleSource
        Stores the LocalizedObject. The LocalizedObject must not have been previously stored for the specified locale.

        store in interface LocaleSource
        Type Parameters:
        L - the localized object parameter type.
        Parameters:
        lo - the object to store.
        locale - the locale to store
        Returns:
        a new LocalizedObject representing the data stored in the database.
        Throws:
        LocaleSourceException - if an error occurs accessing the LocaleSource or the LocalizedObject has already been stored for the specified Locale.
